meanings.definition: Cause continual trouble or distress to
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors were plaguing the entire street with their loud parties.
meanings.sent2: The mosquitoes plaguing the campers made it hard to enjoy the outdoor trip.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel plaguing the bird feeder seemed to be on a mission for snacks.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds plaguing the sky threatened to ruin the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent5: The persistent cough plaguing her sleep finally drove her to see a doctor.

meanings.sent1: The old house was plagued by a family of mice scurrying around the walls.
meanings.sent2: The invasive vines plaguing the garden needed to be removed to save the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ghost plaguing the old mansion turned out to be a friendly prankster.
meanings.sent4: The doubts plaguing his mind were like shadows that followed him everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The memories of the past plaguing her heart slowly faded with time.
